org.lwjgl.glfw

Class Callbacks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.glfw.Callbacks

  • public final class Callbacks
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for GLFW callbacks.

    This class has been designed to work well with import static.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Callbacks.DropConsumerBuffer
      A functional interface that can be used with dropfunNamesApply.
      static interface  Callbacks.DropConsumerString
      A functional interface that can be used with dropfunNamesApply.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void dropfunNamesApply(int count, long names, Callbacks.DropConsumerBuffer consumer)
      Applies the specified Callbacks.DropConsumerBuffer to the specified GLFWdropfun arguments.
      static void dropfunNamesApply(int count, long names, Callbacks.DropConsumerString consumer)
      Applies the specified Callbacks.DropConsumerString to the specified GLFWdropfun arguments.
      static java.nio.ByteBuffer[] dropfunNamesBuffer(int count, long names)
      Converts the specified GLFWdropfun arguments to a ByteBuffer array.
      static java.lang.String[] dropfunNamesString(int count, long names)
      Converts the specified GLFWdropfun arguments to a String array.
      static java.nio.ByteBuffer errorfunDescriptionBuffer(long description)
      Converts the specified GLFWerrorfun description string pointer to a ByteBuffer, with a capacity equal to the UTF-8 encoded string.
      static java.lang.String errorfunDescriptionString(long description)
      Converts the specified GLFWerrorfun description string pointer to a String.
      static GLFWerrorfun errorfunPrint()
      Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that prints the error in the standard error stream.
      static GLFWerrorfun errorfunPrint(java.io.PrintStream stream)
      Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that prints the error in the specified PrintStream.
      static GLFWerrorfun errorfunThrow()
      Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that throws an IllegalStateException when an error occurs.
      static void releaseAllCallbacks(long window)
      Resets all callbacks for the specified GLFW window to NULL and releases all previously set callbacks.

    • Method Detail

      • releaseAllCallbacks

        public static void releaseAllCallbacks(long window)
        Resets all callbacks for the specified GLFW window to NULL and releases all previously set callbacks.
        Parameters:
        window - the GLFW window

      • errorfunPrint

        public static GLFWerrorfun errorfunPrint()
        Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that prints the error in the standard error stream.
        Returns:
        the GLFWerrorfun

      • errorfunPrint

        public static GLFWerrorfun errorfunPrint(java.io.PrintStream stream)
        Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that prints the error in the specified PrintStream.
        Parameters:
        stream - the PrintStream to use
        Returns:
        the GLFWerrorfun

      • errorfunThrow

        public static GLFWerrorfun errorfunThrow()
        Returns a GLFWerrorfun instance that throws an IllegalStateException when an error occurs.
        Returns:
        the GLFWerrorfun

      • errorfunDescriptionBuffer

        public static java.nio.ByteBuffer errorfunDescriptionBuffer(long description)
        Converts the specified GLFWerrorfun description string pointer to a ByteBuffer, with a capacity equal to the UTF-8 encoded string.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWerrorfun invocation. If you wish to use the ByteBuffer after the callback returns, you need to make a copy.

        Parameters:
        description - a pointer to the UTF-8 encoded description string
        Returns:
        the description string, as a ByteBuffer

      • errorfunDescriptionString

        public static java.lang.String errorfunDescriptionString(long description)
        Converts the specified GLFWerrorfun description string pointer to a String.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWerrorfun invocation.

        Parameters:
        description - a pointer to the UTF-8 encoded description string
        Returns:
        the description string

      • dropfunNamesBuffer

        public static java.nio.ByteBuffer[] dropfunNamesBuffer(int count,
                                       long names)
        Converts the specified GLFWdropfun arguments to a ByteBuffer array.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWdropfun invocation. If you wish to use the array after the callback returns, you need to make a deep copy.

        Parameters:
        count - the number of dropped files
        names - pointer to the array of UTF-8 encoded path names of the dropped files
        Returns:
        the array of names, as ByteBuffers

      • dropfunNamesString

        public static java.lang.String[] dropfunNamesString(int count,
                                    long names)
        Converts the specified GLFWdropfun arguments to a String array.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWdropfun invocation.

        Parameters:
        count - the number of dropped files
        names - pointer to the array of UTF-8 encoded path names of the dropped files
        Returns:
        the array of names, as Strings

      • dropfunNamesApply

        public static void dropfunNamesApply(int count,
                     long names,
                     Callbacks.DropConsumerBuffer consumer)
        Applies the specified Callbacks.DropConsumerBuffer to the specified GLFWdropfun arguments.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWdropfun invocation.

        Parameters:
        count - the number of dropped files
        names - pointer to the array of UTF-8 encoded path names of the dropped files
        consumer - the DropConsumerBuffer to apply

      • dropfunNamesApply

        public static void dropfunNamesApply(int count,
                     long names,
                     Callbacks.DropConsumerString consumer)
        Applies the specified Callbacks.DropConsumerString to the specified GLFWdropfun arguments.

        This method may only be used inside a GLFWdropfun invocation.

        Parameters:
        count - the number of dropped files
        names - pointer to the array of UTF-8 encoded path names of the dropped files
        consumer - the DropConsumerString to apply
